question: Question_03_(a)
statement:
\emph{In this question you will state and then apply the Mean Value
Theorem.}

Complete the statement of the Mean Value Theorem

\texttt{Suppose~a~function~$f$~is~continuous~on~the~interval~}\emph{\texttt{{[}a,b{]}}}\texttt{.}\\\texttt{Suppose~further~that~$f$~is~differentiable~on~the~interval~\_\_\_\_\_.}\\\texttt{Then~there~exists~some~}\emph{\texttt{c}}\texttt{~in~the~interval~\_\_\_\_\_~satisfying}\\\\$\displaystyle
f'(c) = \underline{\qquad \qquad}.$
hints:
The conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem relates the instantaneous rate
of change (the derivative, or $f'$) at some point in the interval to the
average rate of change on the interval (the slope between the two
endpoints of the graph).

Watch out whether you want to consider a closed or open interval. It
changes your answer, so be precise.
